meanings.definition: A person who initiates or provokes a conflict or action.
meanings.sent1: The instigator of the argument was quickly identified.
meanings.sent2: The instigator of the fight was known to everyone in the school.
meanings.sent3: The instigator of the food fight was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: She was the instigator of change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The instigator of the protest rallied many supporters.

meanings.definition: Something that causes a particular event or situation to happen.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was the instigator of the dog barking.
meanings.sent2: The lack of sleep was the instigator of her bad mood.
meanings.sent3: The spilled milk was the instigator of the slippery floor.
meanings.sent4: His words were the instigator of her tears.
meanings.sent5: The broken lock was the instigator of the burglary.
